intro: Brassica campestris subsp. vulgaris, commonly known as field mustard, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm and has alternate, pinnately lobed leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers in racemes, followed by long, slender pods containing several seeds. It is often found in disturbed soils, along roadsides, and in agricultural fields. This species is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
